abstract: Wall Street managed a slight gain on Friday, a day after concerns about the economy, and in particular the labor market, sent the Dow plunging. Markets in Europe and Asia ended the day lower.
snippet: Wall Street managed a slight gain on Friday, a day after concerns about the economy, and in particular the labor market, sent the Dow plunging. Markets in Europe and Asia ended the day lower.
lead_paragraph: Trading on Wall Street was mixed on Friday, with the Dow the S.&P. 500 closing up and the Nasdaq falling a few points. The mild trading came a day after concerns about the economy, and in particular the labor market, sent the Dow down 344.65 points.

headline.main: Stocks Withstand Jump in Jobless Rate
headline.print_headline: Markets in Europe and Asia Follow Wall Street Lower

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
